articles.title: Three-eyed predator stalked the seas 500 million years ago

articles.title: Infertility in some men may be caused by X chromosome mutations
articles.description: An international study has identified more than 50 genes on the X chromosome in which mutations may cause poor sperm production

articles.title: UK's latest omicron wave being driven by BA.4 and BA.5 covid variants
articles.description: The latest coronavirus figures from the UK's Office for National Statistics show that around 2.7 million people had covid-19 in the week ending 29 June, as the highly transmissible omicron subvariants BA.4 and BA.5 drive infections

articles.title: Gel-coated battery could stop mobile phones catching fire or exploding
articles.description: A cheap and easily manufactured material can act as a thermal conductor at low temperatures and an insulator at high temperatures, which may help prevent dramatic battery fires and explosions
articles.content:
By Matthew Sparkes
Traditional lithium-ion batteries can overheatLithium-ion batteries used in smartphones and other devices are susceptible to catching fire and even exploding if they begin to over… [+477 chars]

articles.title: World's most sensitive dark matter detector tested for the first time
articles.description: A brief test has proven that the new LUX-ZEPLIN dark matter detector is the most sensitive ever. It may be our best bet for finally finding dark matter particles
articles.content:

The LUX-ZEPLIN dark matter detector at the Sanford Underground Research Facility in South Dakota is the most sensitive ever

articles.title: Southern fin whales have recovered to large numbers in the Antarctic
articles.description: Aerial surveys have found groups of up to 150 fin whales feeding near Antarctica, a sign that populations have bounced back since since the 1976 ban on hunting these whales

articles.title: Meraxes gigas was a huge dinosaur with tiny arms like T. rex
articles.description: A dinosaur discovered in Argentina has been identified as a new species. Meraxes gigas lived 20 million years before T. rex, but had a similarly large body, sharp teeth and proportionately small arms
articles.content:
By Corryn Wetzel
